ibis.io
Interface SerializationInput

All Superinterfaces:
DataInput
All Known Implementing Classes:
ByteSerializationInputStream, DataSerializationInputStream, IbisSerializationInputStream, SunSerializationInputStream
public interface SerializationInput
extends DataInput

The SerializationInput interface specifies which methods must be implemented by any serialization input stream type. Some of these methods may just throw an exception, depending on the serialization type. For instance, the readInt method of a "byte" serialization input stream will just throw an exception.

For all read methods in this interface, the invariant is that the reads must match the writes one by one. The only exception to this rule is that an array written with any of the writeArray methods can be read by readObject(). In particular, an array written with writeObject cannot be read with readArray, because writeObject does duplicate detection, and may have written only a handle.

          Returns the number of bytes that can be read without blocking.

          Closes this stream, but not the underlying streams.

statistics

void statistics()
Prints some statistics.

clear

void clear()
Ibis serialization profits from an explicit clear of the object table, so that any stubs in it can be garbage-collected. This significantly reduces the number of connections kept alive.

readArray

void readArray(Object[] ref)
               throws IOException,
                      ClassNotFoundException
Reads an array of objects in place.

Parameters:

Throws:
IOException - is thrown on an IO error.

readArray

void readArray(Object[] ref,
               int off,
               int len)
               throws IOException,
                      ClassNotFoundException
Reads a slice of an array in place. No cycle checks are done.

Parameters:
ref - array in which the slice is stored
off - offset where the slice starts
len - length of the slice (the number of elements)
Throws:
IOException - is thrown on an IO error.
ClassNotFoundException - is thrown when the class of a serialized object is not found.
